Author: bishop#9773
Content: Is there a resource that has the current time locked coins listed? Obviously maturities will vary but just curious how much of the 27M is unavailable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Mylo(KomodoPioneers)> from the #faq-chosen in verus discord.
Rewards >=192 are time locked.  so about 26 million time locked.  And no you can't see them because only the miner knows the transaction data.
```
Block Reward
1 week smooth linear ramp from 0 to 384, then halving every month (43,200 blocks)
1st week:  Block 1 -> 10080 = 1,935,360 VRSC
1st month: Block 10080 -> 53280 = 384 VRSC = 16,588,800 VRSC
2nd month: Block 53280 -> 96480 = 192 VRSC = 8,294,400 VRSC
3rd month: Block 96480 -> 139680 = 96 VRSC = 4,147,200 VRSC
4th month: Block 139680 -> 182880 = 48 VRSC = 2,073,600 VRSC
5th month: Block 182880 -> 226080 = 24 VRSC = 1,036,800 VRSC
Block 226080 onward for another 2 years = 24 VRSC
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cam - [triforce]> Is there a reasonable reason that a mac downloads the blockchain 5x faster?  I installed 0.3.11 on both machines at the same time, and got them both started within about 30 miinutes of each other.  The mac had the blockchain in 3 hours, the Win10 machine took 16+

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Cam - [triforce]> and now on my Win10 laptop it's been going for 3.5 hours and is at 16%

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @Cam - [triforce] Windows is historically slow on the networking side in Komodo, and I guess Zcash and possibly Bitcoin. I haven't looked deeply into it, but the original Agama even has a workaround to limit the number of connections just on Windows when synching, which speeds up networking as well.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gordon Komodo> I would recommend ubuntu , I was using windows before. It is pretty user friendly.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Andstar> @jimboscott your screenshot shows you have found 2 blocks is that not correct?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <kezz> anyone familiar with komodo that can explain to me how holding in the agama wallet generates 5% interest?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Andstar> The main question is, what happens when you mine to your address and not public key?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> On Komodo, it's actually just a rule of the Komodo blockchain that all nodes can calculate and add the same way when making a transaction. the wallet does not need to be running, as it is not staking in the sense that it does not validate blocks. it is a function of the UTXO age and size.
